text: greetings and welcome to a very quick
guide on distributor replacement for
Chevy v8 Vortech engines if you need
more explanation I have a full length
video version of this one that should
provide all the information that you
need the only thing I'd recommend that I
don't cover in this video is making a
mark on the distributor body as well as
one on the intake manifold in order to
reference it later when installing the
new distributor without this mark you
could potentially set a check engine
light code P 1345 in which you would
need a scan tool in order to set the cam
crank correlation otherwise everything
else should be covered in this video if
you need more information like I said
check out my other video once the
distributor cap is removed you will want
to rotate the engine over the top dead
center number one compression stroke to
do this you'll want to remove the fan
shroud then manually turn the engine
over until the timing mark on the
balancer meets the timing mark on the
timing cover with the timing marks lined
up if the distributor rotor is pointing
at number one spark plug wire then you
know you have the engine in the correct
position if the rotor is pointing at
number six spark plug wire then you need
to rotate the engine over an additional
360 degrees with the engine in the
correct position you can loosen or
remove the distributor hold down bolt as
well as remove the connector for the cam
sensor on the side of the distributor at
that point you can go ahead and lift the
distributor straight out of the engine
okay looking at the new distributor will
notice a few marks that we want to get
lined up before we installed the
distributor first off we have this
dimple here at the bottom of the
distributor what you want to do is line
that dimple up with the white painted
line there
these marks tell us where to set the
distributor before we install it so this
is a starting position of the
distributor when you go to install it
into the engine I took the liberty of
making these two marks right here so the
purpose of these marks this one is where
our final position is this is where our
starting position is so looking back
here that's our final position if the
rotor button were installed
we'd be pointing right here our starting
position as we know is with the Det
dimple and that line lined up so you can
make a mark like that if you want if you
want to install the distributor with
this rotor button already on you can do
that by making this mark this will tell
you where this needs to face and when
it's completely installed it should
point there okay so we've got all the
marks lined up as we talked about and
we're going to install the distributor
make sure that that flat spot on the
distributor is roughly parallel with the
back of the intake manifold
okay we've got the distributor where we
want it so just gonna put this clamp on
the body of the distributor and then
finger tighten this bolt
so you can see a few bumps with the
starter it didn't quite want to drop
down so I just wiggled the base and it
dropped right down into the oil pump
drive so no need to use a screwdriver to
line anything up that's going to waste a
lot of time much easier just to just get
this just get that hold down right there
start it onto the base of the shifter
get the bolt run down just enough to
hold it snug don't tighten that just
finger tight so that this clamp is snug
to the stripper base and then bump the
starter normally it'll just fall right
down by itself but uh but for some
reason it did in that time so I just
wiggled the base right here and it
dropped right down so we'll just barely
tighten this bolt may need to make some
adjustments later okay guys we're gonna
wrap this up one piece of advice I will
give you is if your installed
distributor and does not look almost
identical to this then don't start the
truck because you'll have to reset the
top that Center our number one cylinder
and you're probably gonna get a check
engine light it really needs to be
installed almost identical to what I
have here the rotor should point at the
small triangle with the number eight or
towards the number one spark plug wire
what-have-you if it's not pointing here
and it's pointing back towards the
firewall at number six spark plug then
it's not going to start it needs to
point towards number one if it's not
exactly on number one that's okay but it
has to be very very close if it looks
like it's more than a couple degrees off
then you're gonna have to start over
from scratch or at least pull the
distributor out and see if your off
maybe a tooth or two but if you line up
all the marks like I showed you you
shouldn't have any problems getting it
right on at least the first or second
time so after that go ahead and get your
distributor cap back on your wires back
in place air box back in place as well
as the fan shroud and you should be good
to go
if it has the check engine light P 1345
then and you're sure to your distributor
is installed correctly then you may just
be off slightly in which point if you
can't get it manually adjusted you may
need to have someone with a scan tool to
set that for you thanks again and good
luck
